column4: anyone ever get a "no such file or directory" message for a program that is obviously there?
is that program in the same directory as you are
I do both baudline and ./baudline in the directory where the file is at but no luck
check the ownership of the file. is it marked as executable?
is it a script? where did you get it from?
It is possible it is compiled for the wrong libraries
ask baudline.com if they could make a version for ubuntu
maybe, but the thing is that I don't think the creators of baudline have the source out. I could be mistaken
someone told me earlier that they were able to run baudline on feisty fawn without a problem
